result.execSummary:
The defendant Katelyn C. Hoffmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Katelyn C. Hoffmann is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Katelyn C. Hoffmann was found guilty of Possession of Drug Paraphernalia. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: The forfeiture and costs shall be paid at the rate of $100.00 a month beginning July 22, 2022.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Katelyn C. Hoffmann

records.addlTxt: Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

1:20 PM Defendant Katelyn C. Hoffmann in court.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea agreement recited into the record.  Attorney Fuhr amends count 2 to Possession of drug paraphernalia - Ord. 26.16.  Plea of no contest to the amended charge.  Court finds defendant guilty and orders a forfeiture in the amount of $263.50 plus $67.00 victim witness surcharge.  The costs shall be paid at the rate of $100.00 a month beginning July 22, 2022.  Court dismisses count 1.  - rt
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.
*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.

1:31 PM Defendant Katelyn C. Hoffmann in court.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives reading of complaint, charges and penalties. Court advised defendant of right to attorney.   Court enters a plea of not guilty on defendant's behalf.  Court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 booking.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
